Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision on evidence review, credibility assessment, and well-founded fear of persecution was unreasonable
Application_Facts: Applicants claimed refugee protection due to domestic abuse and fear of FGM in Cameroon
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Court_Ruling: Application allowed; matter remitted for reconsideration by a different Board member
Defendant_Behavior: Board ignored or misinterpreted key evidence such as death certificate and police reports; failed to assess FGM risk independently for minor
Grounds_for_Claim: Domestic abuse, risk of female genital mutilation (FGM) in Cameroon
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard under subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of evidence, well-founded fear of persecution, risk of FGM
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review challenging dismissal of refugee claim
Credibility_Assessment: Board's credibility assessment found flawed due to ignoring key evidence
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act

Governing_Rule: The reasonableness standard governs judicial review of the Boardâ€™s decisions
Outcome: Court found decision unreasonable; case remitted for reconsideration
Harm_Assessment: Risk of FGM and harm from domestic abuse in Cameroon
Cause_Description: Applicants feared persecution due to domestic abuse and risk of FGM in Cameroon
Evidence_Handling: Failure to properly consider or analyze submitted evidence
Legal_Provision_Violated: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Issues: Ignored or misinterpreted evidence, lack of independent risk analysis for minor
